alert.note: Alert for Leake (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 21 at 8:37PM CDT until further notice by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi... Yockanookany River Near Ofahoma affecting Leake County. Yockanookany River Near Kosciusko affecting Attala County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yockanookany River Near Ofahoma. * WHEN...From late Tuesday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Minor overbank flooding of farmland along the river is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Monday the stage was 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Wednesday morning and continue rising to a crest of 20.9 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Yockanookany River Ofahoma 19.0 16.0 Mon 7 pm CDT 17.1 20.3 20.5 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Forecast includes rainfall on the ground and 48 hours of additional rainfall. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 9 AM CDT.
